title: Greek Orzo Salad Recipe
description: This easy orzo salad is packed with cucumber, feta, tomato, artichokes, and olives for a colorful summer pasta salad full of Greek flavors.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Pasta and Noodles Pasta by Shape Recipes Orzo Recipes Greek Orzo Salad 4.6 (625) 471 Reviews 48 Photos This orzo salad with cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, feta, lemon, and oregano is a delicious and colorful summer pasta salad full of Greek flavors. I receive a lot of requests for this recipe. Submitted by Patrice Updated on April 11, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 48 48 48 48 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 ½ cups uncooked orzo pasta 2 (6 ounce) cans marinated artichoke hearts 1 cucumber, seeded and chopped 1 ripe tomato, seeded and chopped 1 red onion, chopped 1 cup crumbled feta cheese 1 (2 ounce) can black olives, drained ¼ cup chopped fresh parsley 1 tablespoon lemon juice ½ teaspoon dried oregano ½ teaspoon lemon pepper Directions Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes; drain. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Drain artichoke hearts, reserving liquid. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Gather prepared ingredients together. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine pasta, artichoke hearts, cucumber, tomato, onion, feta, olives, parsley, lemon juice, oregano, and lemon pepper in a large bowl; toss well. Chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Just before serving, drizzle reserved artichoke marinade over salad. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 1,019 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 393 Calories 13g Fat 57g Carbs 14g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 393 % Daily Value * Total Fat 13g 17% Saturated Fat 5g 23% Cholesterol 22mg 7% Sodium 968mg 42% Total Carbohydrate 57g 21% Dietary Fiber 7g 24% Total Sugars 7g Protein 14g 28% Vitamin C 23mg 26% Calcium 180mg 14% Iron 3mg 18% Potassium 624mg 13% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Greek Orzo Salad 01 of 48 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 48 Photo by  Howard 08/10/2020 03 of 48 Photo by  Eve2278 06/13/2020 I made this recipe using the EXACT ingredients listed. After chilling a couple of hours we decided we did not need to use the reserve artichoke marinade. The salad was delicious and moist. The olives, tomatoes & cucumbers saw to that. Thank you for sharing, will definitely be made again & again. It was quick & easy. We also like the addition of the lemon pepper seasoning, very good... 04 of 48 Photo by  yolisalou 05/27/2020 This is an absolutely delicious and easy recipe! Will be making it again and again, this summer! Many thanks for posting this! 05 of 48 Photo by  Leigh Herring Carreon 05/05/2020 Loved the Greek lemon dressing! 06 of 48 Photo by  Wjakes 05/12/2019 Love this recipe! Always a request teamed up with BBQ chicken. We love the recipe just the way it is directed, but enjoy reading how others change it up! Thanks for another great recipe! 07 of 48 Photo by  Yolanda Humby 05/11/2019 I really liked this salad. I made some changes to the dressing like others suggested and left out the artichoke because I’m not fond of it. I also used kalamata olives, which added a nice flavour. 08 of 48 Photo by  scannerz 05/08/2019 I made this recipe for a Lunch barbecue for a few friends and family. I made enough for 20 people and they only variation to the recipe was that I did not use black olives due to the fact that there were several people in the family who didn’t like them. I personally will add them the next time I make this recipe and will use it again it was delicious and a big hit with everybody! 09 of 48 Photo by  Kimiko 07/30/2018 The salad itself is great, but my husband and I agree that it was a bit flavorless. Had I seen the review to add red wine vinegar instead of the artichoke marinade I would have done that. Might still do that with the leftovers. Other than that, it was great for a hot day when I didn’t want to eat anything warm. 10 of 48 Photo by  Aaron Austin 02/03/2018 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Orzo and Tomato Salad with Feta Cheese 276 Ratings Ali's Greek Tortellini Salad 277 Ratings Greek Pasta Salad with Shrimp, Tomatoes, Zucchini, Peppers, and Feta 165 Ratings Mediterranean Orzo Salad 27 Ratings Spinach and Tortellini Salad 444 Ratings Minty Orzo Lentil and Feta Salad 84 Ratings Italian Confetti Pasta Salad 429 Ratings Garden Pasta Salad 508 Ratings Penne, Tomato, and Mozzarella Salad 134 Ratings Easy Rainbow Pasta Salad 172 Ratings Spinach and Orzo Salad 859 Ratings Easy Spaghetti Salad 131 Ratings Awesome Bow Tie Pasta 228 Ratings Couscous with a Kick! 55 Ratings Orzo and Broccoli Salad (No Mayo) 1 Rating Ramen and Cabbage Salad 453 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
